DataElement.preferredName: Begin Alcohol Use Age Year Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents at what age a person began drinking regularly.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.:A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: At what age did you begin dri
ReferenceDocuments.description: At what age did you begin drinking regularly?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Enter a whole number (i.e. "4") only. Do not enter a range or fraction.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: At what age did you begin drinking regularly?  ___________ years of age

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/5/18 jk created to replace CDE 5776094 which was created with a string VD datatype in error for the 2012 SVAR Template.
